SEARCH
Package executor.service.service.step

Class AbstractStepExecution

java.lang.Object
executor.service.service.step.AbstractStepExecution
All Implemented Interfaces:
StepExecution
Direct Known Subclasses:
StepExecutionClickCss, StepExecutionClickXpath, StepExecutionSleep
public abstract class AbstractStepExecution extends Object implements StepExecution
An abstract base class implementing the StepExecution interface, providing a skeletal implementation for step execution logic.

The AbstractStepExecution class is designed to be extended by concrete implementations for specific step actions. It implements the StepExecution interface, defining the contract for executing steps within a scenario.

Concrete subclasses must provide the implementation for the abstract method executeStepLogic(WebDriver, Step), where the actual logic for executing a step with a specific action is defined. This method receives a WebDriver instance and a Step object as parameters, allowing access to the web browser context and the details of the step to be executed.

This abstract class promotes code reuse and encapsulation of common functionality across different step actions, facilitating the creation of a diverse set of step execution implementations based on specific actions, such as clicking elements, waiting, or interacting with web elements.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • executeStepLogic

      protected abstract void executeStepLogic(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver webDriver, Step step)
      Executes the specific logic for a step action using the provided WebDriver and Step parameters.

      This method is intended to be implemented by concrete subclasses, providing the actual logic for executing a step with a specific action. The implementation has access to the web browser context through the WebDriver instance and can utilize the details of the step from the Step object.

      The implementation of this method is crucial for defining the behavior of a step execution. It should contain the necessary steps to perform the action associated with the step, considering the provided WebDriver instance and the details of the step obtained from the Step object.

      It is expected that the implementation handles any exceptions that may occur during the execution and appropriately communicates the result or throws a custom exception specific to step execution if necessary.

      Parameters:
      webDriver - The WebDriver instance representing the web browser context.
      step - The Step object containing details of the step to be executed.
      Throws:
      StepExecutionException - If an error occurs during the execution of the step action.
      See Also:
      • StepExecution
      • Step
      • WebDriver
      • StepExecutionException

    • step

      public StepResult step(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver webDriver, Step step)
      Executes a step using the provided WebDriver and Step parameters, handling potential exceptions and returning a corresponding StepResult.

      The step method is responsible for orchestrating the execution of a step by calling the abstract executeStepLogic(WebDriver, Step) method in this class. It encapsulates the logic to catch exceptions thrown during the step execution and translates them into a meaningful StepResult that includes the status of the execution (SUCCESS or FAIL) along with additional details such as error messages.

      If the execution of executeStepLogic(WebDriver, Step) is successful, a StepResult with ExecutionStatus.SUCCESS is returned. If a WebDriverException is encountered, it results in a StepResult with ExecutionStatus.FAIL and includes the raw error message from the WebDriverException. Any other exceptions are also treated as failures, and the corresponding error message is included in the StepResult.

      This method serves as a central point for managing step executions and provides a consistent way to handle exceptions that may occur during the step execution process. It enhances the robustness of the step execution mechanism by translating various exception types into a unified StepResult representation.

      Specified by:
      step in interface StepExecution
      Parameters:
      webDriver - The WebDriver instance representing the web browser context.
      step - The Step object containing details of the step to be executed.
      Returns:
      A StepResult representing the outcome of the step execution.
      See Also:
      • StepResult
      • StepExecution
      • Step
      • ExecutionStatus
